intro: Myosotis stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream sides. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is known for its delicate appearance and early spring blooming period. Myosotis stenophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also valued in traditional Māori medicine.
